etymology.description: Pictogram – cowrie used as currency in ancient China; simplified form of 貝 in cursive script.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a cowry shell, an object that functioned as early money, which motivates the senses “cowry; money.” In the simplified set, its strokes were streamlined by adopting a cursive-style form of 貝.
etymology.simplification: Adopted the cursive-script variant of 貝, reducing strokes and complexity.

examples.chinese: 古代用贝(貝)当作货币(貨幣)。
examples.english: In ancient times, cowries were used as currency.

examples.chinese: 海滩(海灘)上有很多贝(貝)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎitān shang yǒu hěn duō bèi.
examples.english: There are many shells on the beach.

examples.chinese: 这串项链(這串項鍊)是用贝(貝)做的。
examples.pinyin: Zhè chuàn xiàngliàn shì yòng bèi zuò de.
examples.english: This necklace is made of shells.
